001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.line;
002
003import java.util.Locale;
004
005import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
006import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
007
008/**
009 * This class represents a line in slope-intercept form: y = k x + d.
010 * Instances are immutable. Not all possible lines in the 2D plane
011 * can be represented.
012 */
013public class SlopeInterceptLine {
014        
015        private final double k, d;
016
017        public SlopeInterceptLine(double k, double d) {
018                this.k = k;
019                this.d = d;
020        }
021        
022        public double getK() {
023                return k;
024        }
025
026        public double getD() {
027                return d;
028        }
029        
030        public double[] getParameters() {
031                return new double[] {k, d};
032        }
033        
034        public static SlopeInterceptLine from(AlgebraicLine al) {
035                double[] p = al.getParameters();        // =(A,B,C)
036                if (Arithmetic.isZero(p[1])) {          // B == 0?
037                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert vertical line (B=0)");
038                }
039                return new SlopeInterceptLine(-p[0]/p[1], -p[2]/p[1]);  // =(-A/B, -C/B)
040        }
041        
042        @Override
043        public String toString() {
044                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <k=%.3f, d=%.3f>",
045                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), k, d);
046        }
047        
048        // --------------------------------------------------
049        
050        public static void main (String[] args) {
051                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
052                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
053                AlgebraicLine al1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
054                System.out.println("al1 = " + al1);
055                SlopeInterceptLine sl = SlopeInterceptLine.from(al1);
056                System.out.println("sl = " + sl);
057                AlgebraicLine al2 = AlgebraicLine.from(sl);
058                System.out.println("al2 = " + al2);
059                System.out.println("al1 = al2 ? " + al1.equals(al2));
060        }
061        /*
062        al1 = AlgebraicLine <a=-0.316, b=0.949, c=-1.581>
063        sl = SlopeInterceptLine <k=0.333, d=1.667>
064        al2 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
065        al1 = al2 ? true
066        */
067}
